text: Before Mueller madness, I got to slip into the studio and had soooo much fun with ⁦@juliastmi⁩ and ⁦@GeeDee215⁩ on ⁦@NPRItsBeenAMin⁩ — listen!
author: NPRnie

text: Here's a ridiculous question to ponder while you're #waitingformueller -- have we ever seen AG Barr and the kid from "A Christmas Story" in the same room?
author: NPRnie

text: I love @cspan so much. I am so thrilled to celebrate 40 years of this essential national institution. But why doesn't http://cspan.org  redirect to http://c-span.org ???
author: NPRnie

text: There’s a lot of anticipation going on in these parts. Which do you wish would just get on with it?
author: NPRnie

text: Versailles, Kentucky. Buchanan, Virginia. Basically every town in Iowa: Keokuk, pronounced two ways, Tripoli (trih-POE-luh), Sigourney (SIG-urr-ney), and on, and on h/t @IowaPublicRadio
author: NPRnie

text: Dem candidate @PeteButtigieg told NPR: "Now they have to make sense, they have to be something that can earn respect on both sides of the aisle, but we shouldn't be afraid of talking about big ideas."
author: NPRnie

text: Trump is trying to paint Dems as extreme, but many in 2020 race are betting that radical ideas are the way to go. @scottdetrow reports:

text: And it’s important to remember you don’t have to consume everything. A mistake I made both on my first visit to Cheesecake Factory AND my first campaign
